intro: Chaerophyllum tainturieri var. floridanum, commonly known as Florida cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
